Class FileManagement

extends java.lang.Object

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a file exists in a specific path.
        Parameters:
        str - A string containing a path.
        Returns:
        A boolean variable that is set to true if the file exists, and false if not.

      • isFilePath

        public static boolean isFilePath(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a string is a representative of a file path.
        Parameters:
        str - A string that representative of a file path or not.
        Returns:
        A boolean variable that is set to true if the string is a representative of a file path, and false if not.

      • hasBom

        public static boolean hasBom(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a string begins with Byte Order Mark.
        Parameters:
        str - A string that begins with Byte Order Mark or not.
        Returns:
        A boolean variable that is set to true if the string begins with Byte Order Mark., and false if not.

      • fileParser

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fileParser(java.nio.file.Path file)
        Breaks down a text file into lower case words with no punctuation and stores them in a LinkedHashMap.

        This method is used to read with a BufferedReader from - temporary or not - files that contain the user's input. The test is broken into words; these are procedurally stored in a LinkedHashMap with a String "Line: x Level: x" as their key. The method also prints a message to inform the user whether his file was processed or not. For, now, the program supports only UTF-8 encoding

        Parameters:
        file - A UTF-8 text file.
        Returns:
        A LinkedHashMap containing a string of the position of each word as its keys and the words themselves as values.

      • readDictionary

        public static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> readDictionary(java.lang.String fileName)
        Breaks down a text file into words and stores them in a HashSet, which represents the dictionary - a collection of most of the words of the respective language.

        This method is used for the storage of dictionaries, which are later searched and compared with Strings to determine if they are correct or not. This method is extremely dependent on the format chosen; the text file contains one String per line.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The path of the file containing the dictionary.
        Returns:
        A HashSet which contains every word from the dictionary.

      • readDictionaryWeb

        public static java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> readDictionaryWeb(java.lang.String location)
        Breaks down a text file from the web into words and stores them in a HashSet, which represents the dictionary - a collection of most of the words of the respective language.

        This method is used for the storage of dictionaries, which are later searched and compared with Strings to determine if they are correct or not. This method is extremely dependent on the format chosen; the text file contains one String per line. This method is used for bigger dictionaries (language dictionaries) stored in the web.

        Parameters:
        location - The URL of the file containing the dictionary.
        Returns:
        A HashSet which contains every word from the dictionary.
